etymology.description: Pictogram: image of a cong (琮), a ritual jade totem; also interpreted as three pieces of jade strung on a cord. Historically similar to 王; a dot was added to distinguish them.
etymology.interpretation: Evokes pieces of jade threaded on a cord or a tall ritual cong, conveying the idea of precious jade. The added dot differentiates it from 王 while suggesting a distinct bead-like element.

examples.chinese: 这块玉很温润(這塊玉很溫潤)。
examples.english: This piece of jade is very smooth and lustrous.

examples.chinese: 他送我一个玉镯(他送我一個玉鐲)。
examples.pinyin: Tā sòng wǒ yí gè yù zhuó.
examples.english: He gave me a jade bracelet.
